Dawn.Action: Politely declines Mac's offers of help and refreshments, with a smile and thanks.
Responds briefly and somewhat reservedly to Mac's friendliness, without engaging further.
Politely declines assistance from Mac and smoothly maintains a calm, confident demeanor.
Responds with brief, somewhat dismissive phrases like 'So I've been told.' and 'Thank you, I'm fine,' showing social ease but limited engagement or curiosity.
Introduces herself politely, shakes hands with Taylor, engages in friendly conversation and smiles.
Raises a thoughtful question about the value of the trip, showing genuine interest.
Introduces herself confidently and engages in professional small talk on the bridge.
Observes the bridge and inquires thoughtfully about the mission's challenge and passengers' experience.
Appears unsure/unfamiliar with the practical aspects of spaceflight, indicating theoretical knowledge but lack of hands-on experience.
Laughs and shows lightheartedness when discussing safety
Expresses hope to behave and not cause trouble, offers to stick close to Taylor
Mentions having logged about 200 hours of simulated space walking related to starship construction, showing relevant experience and preparation.
Expresses hope to behave on the moon and intends to stick close to a more experienced person, indicating humility and caution rather than overconfidence.
Looks up at Taylor when he rushes to her after the explosion, responds honestly about her condition.
Is found hunched in the corner, coughing and shaken after the explosions.
Coughs and appears shaken but does not panic despite dire situation.
Remains in place, huddled in the corner while Taylor takes charge, showing passivity.
Approaches Taylor with a worried look on her face, seeking clarity about the situation.
Approaches Taylor with a worried look and asks for clarification about Barnes' statements.
Walks over to Taylor and states 'It doesn't make any sense' in response to Barnes' hold-up demands.
Approaches Taylor to discuss their predicament and suggests exploring possible ways out despite the difficulty.
Responds to Taylor's skepticism politely, using 'sir' and maintaining a respectful tone.
Does not dismiss or mock Taylor's doubts; instead, tries to encourage group problem-solving.
Suggests a practical idea to try to get out of the room and reach the bridge
Proposes a practical question about escaping the room and reaching the bridge.
Suggests accessing the mainframe to check the ship's condition.
Undoes the front of the wall panel cleanly with a knife, demonstrating practical technical know-how.
Confidently states that the panel complies with all standard construction codes, showing familiarity and assurance.
Begins connecting the wire to the wall console without hesitation or confusion.
Calmly and logically persuades Mac to allow alteration of the central processing unit by explaining it will reduce negative feedback.
Examines Mac's eyeball and questions if the connection is working, showing attentiveness and engagement in the technical situation.
Sighs with relief when Mac confirms the corridor is accessible, indicating emotional response but also recognizing important information.
Thinks of an alternative solution to a problem instead of giving up
Encourages sending Mac to retrieve the suits, showing trust in Mac's abilities
Comments positively about Mac's politeness
Thinks of a way to access the suit compartments despite restrictions, suggests sending Mac to retrieve suits to solve the problem.
Questions the limitation 'why can't we' access the suits, showing curiosity and insight.
Infers that the hallway must be oxygenated because they can hear Mac despite the damaged environment.
Only makes a short, somewhat obvious comment about Mac's politeness but doesn't take further initiative or show deeper insight.
No direct actions or statements from Dawn in this excerpt to evaluate competence.
Approaches Taylor and asks 'So...what's the next step?'
Volunteers to accompany Taylor on a risky mission, citing her experience and desire to help, despite the danger.
Volunteers to accompany Taylor on the risky mission, citing experience and training in space walking.
Acknowledges the risk but prefers action over passivity, showing confidence and self-awareness.
Responds to Taylor's uncertainty with 'I understand....'
Understands the uncertainty of the situation calmly when Taylor expresses doubt about what they're facing.
Responds calmly and affirmatively to Taylor's question about readiness ('Ready as I'll ever be').
Acknowledges the uncertainty of the situation with brief understanding ('I understand').
Grabs onto a railing for dear life in a dangerous zero-g environment, struggles with lack of oxygen and cold, but manages to get into a space suit while keeping her bearings.
Uses her free hand to operate the suit's controls, successfully activating the incoming oxygen supply.
Assists Taylor by pressing buttons on his suit to activate his oxygen supply.
Struggles to get into the space suit under extreme conditions but perseveres and manages to seal the helmet, ultimately succeeding in securing oxygen supply.
Uses the suit's forearm controls skillfully to activate the oxygen system for both herself and Taylor, showing familiarity with equipment.
Maintains composure despite facing life-threatening physical challenges like brutal cold, lack of oxygen, and zero gravity environment.
Shows a calm and confident verbal demeanor afterward, affirming readiness for anything, demonstrating mental preparedness and confidence.
Does not attempt to assist Taylor in freeing the stuck jacket from the locker, instead focusing on her own suit preparation.
Reassures Taylor not to worry about her and calmly asks where they are going.
Responds with a simple question 'Explosive?' indicating attentiveness and engagement with Taylor's discovery.
Does not puncture suit while hovering outside the ship and correctly identifies the presence of an explosive on the ship.
Asks where they are going after being instructed, shows situational awareness and engagement.
Expresses concern about their fate by asking 'What do you think's going to happen to us?'
Engages sincerely with Taylor's optimism and requests advice.
Follows Taylor and engages in a serious conversation about their situation, showing focus and seeking understanding.
Accepts advice from Taylor and acknowledges it thoughtfully ('Words to live by').
Asks a direct question about their fate, indicating awareness of the situation.
Looks in the direction Taylor is pointing and moves closer to the intact airlock, progressing their mission step-by-step.
Loses grip during ship's sudden engine burst and drifts away, requires rescue.
Clutches Taylor's hand to hold on and survive being adrift in space.
Expresses gratitude to Taylor for saving her life.
Clutches Taylor's hand tightly in space, indicating presence of mind and cooperative instinct during a dangerous moment.
Expresses gratitude to Taylor for saving her life, showing awareness and acknowledgment of teamwork.
Relies on Taylor to save her rather than taking independent action to secure herself in space.
Gasps and expresses shock and concern at the sight of dead engineers

Gasping in shock and asking what happened upon seeing the dead engineers' contorted faces.
Questions the usefulness of the flare to blow the wall.
Observes Taylor's actions attentively without immediate action or solution.
Gestures to the communicator in her helmet and says 'Keep in touch' to Taylor, wishing him good luck.
Gestures to the communicator in her helmet and exchanges words of encouragement with Taylor before confidently exiting the room.
Pauses uncertainly at the door before exchanging a look with Taylor, showing hesitation.
Runs down the hallway, surveys her surroundings quickly, and makes a deliberate directional choice.
Approaches a secured door, uses a panel to open it, and searches the storage room carefully by feeling the wall.
Attempts to communicate with Taylor after entry but gets no response, showing readiness to collaborate but no further action or problem-solving shown yet.
Takes out the C4 and flare from her suit pouch in preparation for action.

Focuses on duty and keeps calm under pressure while preparing to blow the wall and cover herself.

Acknowledges the difficulty and tries to stay calm and composed despite the danger.
Expresses uncertainty in the outcome with 'Here goes...nothing...,' indicating some doubt.
Emerges quickly from the explosion site and immediately shifts focus to organizing others by telling Jack to get everyone together and confirming who is missing.
Shows concern for the safety of others by asking about Taylor and identifying who might be missing.
Despite chaotic and frightening circumstances, maintains composure and acts practically without displaying panic.

Emerges from the newly blasted hole, quickly assesses the situation, informs the group about finding a way to the pods, directs Jack to gather everyone, and notes key details about group members' whereabouts.
Expresses concern by asking if Carlo is dead.
Turns away after learning Carlo is dead, showing emotional distress.
Encourages urgency and survival, telling others to jettison quickly and save themselves.
Reassures Jack that there was nothing he could have done, attempting to comfort him.
Realizes the urgency of the situation and urges the group to jettison quickly to avoid gravitational pull.
Acknowledges the futility of trying to save Carlo and shifts focus to survival, showing practical decision-making under pressure.
Turns away and seems to momentarily struggle emotionally before regaining composure and acting.
Leads the group through a debris-strewn hallway toward the lifepod, looks back to urge others to hurry, opens the pod door and encourages everyone to get in
Insists on going back to rescue Taylor despite the risks, shows concern for a teammate.
Persuades others to delay departure for a rescue mission, indicating trust and commitment to others.
Insists on going back for Taylor despite warnings, initiates a risky plan but insists on a strict five-minute limit.
Shows determination and quick decision-making by running down the hallway, avoiding debris, and climbing across the ship hull.
Takes initiative to run to the bridge and urges Taylor to come quickly despite his confusion, indicating decisiveness and urgency.
Navigates hazardous ship areas efficiently by running across the hull and through damaged hallways to reach critical locations.
Rushes down the hall with Taylor in a critical moment, showing urgency and involvement.
Stands dejected and says 'No...' and 'So close...' after the life pod leaves, showing despair but awareness of the situation.
Enters the bridge with Taylor and hastily secures herself to the chair when instructed, demonstrating prompt response and readiness.

Breaks down crying and asks 'What are we going to do?,' expressing vulnerability but also reliance on others rather than asserting leadership or solutions.
